trans-unit.source: How to: Host Login Pages in Your ASP.NET Web Application
trans-unit.target: How to: Host Login Pages in Your ASP.NET Web Application

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: How to: Host Login Pages in Your ASP.NET Web Application
trans-unit.target: How to: Host Login Pages in Your ASP.NET Web Application

trans-unit.source: Applies To
trans-unit.target: Applies To

trans-unit.source: Microsoft® Azure™ Access Control Service (ACS)
trans-unit.target: Microsoft® Azure™ Access Control Service (ACS)

trans-unit.source: ASP.NET
trans-unit.target: ASP.NET

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to host a login page in your ASP.NET application.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to host a login page in your ASP.NET application.

trans-unit.source: This method allows to fully customize your login page with regards to its layout, look, and feel.
trans-unit.target: This method allows to fully customize your login page with regards to its layout, look, and feel.

trans-unit.source: The communication from your custom login page to <token>secondref_acs</token> is performed over the JSON feed that <token>secondref_acs</token> exposes.
trans-unit.target: The communication from your custom login page to <token>secondref_acs</token> is performed over the JSON feed that <token>secondref_acs</token> exposes.

trans-unit.source: To enable full control over the appearance, behavior, and location of your federated login page, <token>secondref_acs</token> provides a JSON-encoded metadata feed that provides the names, login URLs, images, and email domain names (AD FS only) for your identity providers.
trans-unit.target: To enable full control over the appearance, behavior, and location of your federated login page, <token>secondref_acs</token> provides a JSON-encoded metadata feed that provides the names, login URLs, images, and email domain names (AD FS only) for your identity providers.

trans-unit.source: This feed is known as the “Home Realm Discovery Metadata Feed.”
trans-unit.target: This feed is known as the “Home Realm Discovery Metadata Feed.”

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> provides an example of a custom login page that includes the necessary code to communicate with the Home Realm Discovery Metadata Feed.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> provides an example of a custom login page that includes the necessary code to communicate with the Home Realm Discovery Metadata Feed.

trans-unit.source: This page can be downloaded and fully customized.
trans-unit.target: This page can be downloaded and fully customized.

trans-unit.target: Contents

trans-unit.source: Objectives
trans-unit.target: Objectives

trans-unit.source: Becoming familiar with a login page in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Becoming familiar with a login page in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Ensuring that each objective is expressed as a specific task
trans-unit.target: Ensuring that each objective is expressed as a specific task

trans-unit.source: Hosting a login page in an ASP.NET web application to provide a consistent look and feel.
trans-unit.target: Hosting a login page in an ASP.NET web application to provide a consistent look and feel.

trans-unit.source: Summary of Steps
trans-unit.target: Summary of Steps

trans-unit.source: Step 1 – Download an Example Custom Login Page
trans-unit.target: Step 1 – Download an Example Custom Login Page

trans-unit.source: Step 2 – Customize the Look and Feel of Your Custom Login Page
trans-unit.target: Step 2 – Customize the Look and Feel of Your Custom Login Page

trans-unit.source: Step 3 – Integrate a Custom Login Page in an ASP.NET Web Application
trans-unit.target: Step 3 – Integrate a Custom Login Page in an ASP.NET Web Application

trans-unit.source: Step 1 – Download an Example Custom Login Page
trans-unit.target: Step 1 – Download an Example Custom Login Page

trans-unit.source: This step shows how to download an example custom login page.
trans-unit.target: This step shows how to download an example custom login page.

trans-unit.source: You will use the example custom login page to customize to your needs and then host it in your ASP.NET application.
trans-unit.target: You will use the example custom login page to customize to your needs and then host it in your ASP.NET application.

trans-unit.source: To download an example custom login page
trans-unit.target: To download an example custom login page

trans-unit.source: If you were not authenticated using Windows Live® ID, you will be required to do so.
trans-unit.target: If you were not authenticated using Windows Live® ID, you will be required to do so.

trans-unit.source: After being authenticated with your <token>ms_acct</token>, you are redirected to the <ui>My Projects</ui> page on the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: After being authenticated with your <token>ms_acct</token>, you are redirected to the <ui>My Projects</ui> page on the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Click the desired project name on the <ui>My Project</ui> page.
trans-unit.target: Click the desired project name on the <ui>My Project</ui> page.

trans-unit.source: On the project’s detail page, locate the desired namespace, and then click the <ui>Access Control</ui> link in the <ui>Manage</ui> column.
trans-unit.target: On the project’s detail page, locate the desired namespace, and then click the <ui>Access Control</ui> link in the <ui>Manage</ui> column.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Access Control Settings</ui> page, click <ui>Manage Access Control</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Access Control Settings</ui> page, click <ui>Manage Access Control</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down to the <ui>Develop</ui> section, and then click the <ui>Application Integration</ui> link.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down to the <ui>Develop</ui> section, and then click the <ui>Application Integration</ui> link.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Login Pages</ui> section, click the <ui>Login Pages</ui> link.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Login Pages</ui> section, click the <ui>Login Pages</ui> link.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Login Page Integration</ui> page, click the desired relying party application in the <ui>Relying Party Application</ui> column.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Login Page Integration</ui> page, click the desired relying party application in the <ui>Relying Party Application</ui> column.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Login Page Integration: <<Your Replying Party>></ui> page, locate <ui>Option 2: Host the login page as part of your application section</ui>, and then click the <ui>Download Example Login Page</ui> button.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Login Page Integration: <<Your Replying Party>></ui> page, locate <ui>Option 2: Host the login page as part of your application section</ui>, and then click the <ui>Download Example Login Page</ui> button.

trans-unit.source: Save the page to an arbitrary location.
trans-unit.target: Save the page to an arbitrary location.

trans-unit.source: This is the page you will use for customization.
trans-unit.target: This is the page you will use for customization.

trans-unit.source: The page’s name is usually <ui><<YourRealm>>LoginPageCode.html</ui>.
trans-unit.target: The page’s name is usually <ui><<YourRealm>>LoginPageCode.html</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Step 2 – Customizing the Look and Feel of Your Custom Login Page
trans-unit.target: Step 2 – Customizing the Look and Feel of Your Custom Login Page

trans-unit.source: In this step you customize the example custom login page you downloaded in previous page.
trans-unit.target: In this step you customize the example custom login page you downloaded in previous page.

trans-unit.source: Use any HTML editor of your choice—it can be as simple as Notepad or as robust as the Visual Studio® 2010 HTML Editor.
trans-unit.target: Use any HTML editor of your choice—it can be as simple as Notepad or as robust as the Visual Studio® 2010 HTML Editor.

trans-unit.source: Design the look and feel of your custom login page to your desire.
trans-unit.target: Design the look and feel of your custom login page to your desire.

trans-unit.source: Step 3 – Integrating a Custom Login Page in an ASP.NET Web Application
trans-unit.target: Step 3 – Integrating a Custom Login Page in an ASP.NET Web Application

trans-unit.source: In this step you integrate your newly designed custom login page with your ASP.NET web application.
trans-unit.target: In this step you integrate your newly designed custom login page with your ASP.NET web application.

trans-unit.source: Copy your newly designed custom login page into a public location in your ASP.NET web application—usually the root folder.
trans-unit.target: Copy your newly designed custom login page into a public location in your ASP.NET web application—usually the root folder.

trans-unit.source: Expose the URL to your custom login page on a public page, usually Default.aspx.
trans-unit.target: Expose the URL to your custom login page on a public page, usually Default.aspx.

trans-unit.source: Unauthenticated users will click it to be authenticated.
trans-unit.target: Unauthenticated users will click it to be authenticated.
